website_summaries.verdict: For a budget-priced sound bar system, the Polk Signa S1 sounds a lot bigger than it really is.
pros: The Signa S1 offers excellent music replay for the money and decent intelligibility in movies
The provision of a separate subwoofer means it can go lower than some competitors that lack subs
cons: Less clarity and dynamic punch with action-packed movies compared to some rivals

customer_reviews.title: Distortion, lack of controls - not what expected - RESOLVED BY POLK
customer_reviews.text: Sound has distortion at times. Raising the volume increases the base and speech is distorted with an echo when loud. Not the quality I have experienced with Polk products in the past. Inadequate controls - has only 6 settings for the sound which do not produce the sound quality expected. Was very easy to set up. Bass is very good. ****** 1/3/18***FOLLOW UP: Reported the problem to Polk. Polk promptly sent me a replacement bar that has outstanding performance. Evidently the bar I received initially was defective but Polk stood behind their product with a resolution.
customer_reviews.author: RustonRed

customer_reviews.title: awesome soundbar!
customer_reviews.text: Huge improvement over the sound you get out of a typical TV. Super easy to set up, easy to use, and looks great. I'm thinking about buying a second one for my other TV. It does turn off automatically if there is no sound for a while (I'd estimate about 10 minutes). It would be nice if that feature could be adjusted or turned off, but not a huge issue. The remote is nice but sometimes you have to press the on/off button more than once to get it to respond. I've used it with the included optical cable as well as with bluetooth. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly H

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Really a good unit, I'm very pleased with it. The only reason I am docking it one star is the remote is pitifully weak. Why did they design it with a single battery? Seems like you have to be right on top of the soundbar for the remote to even work, and then the response times are verrrrrrry slow. Come up with a stronger remote with faster response times and this soundbar would be virtually perfect. Polk rocks!!
customer_reviews.author: whooziss

customer_reviews.title: Buy it now
customer_reviews.text: Great sound in a small system. Bass could be a a bit more powerful but overall the quality is great. The instructions are simple maybe a bit to simple? I would highly recommend this sound bar as a budget friendly with great sound option.

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money.

customer_reviews.author: Karl Lee Soule

customer_reviews.title: Great product! But terrible bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Bought this when it was on sale and I enjoyed it. It was easy to set up and the sound was great. Good for sport ans action movies due to the solid bass. If you are a music lover, try another product. Last night was the first time I tried the Bluetooth function, it was terrible. It worked perfectly with my Alexa connected nearby but any effort to keep the sound clear more than 2ft away was terminated. I guess it was not designed for distant controlling
customer_reviews.author: glees shin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound from a smaller set up.
customer_reviews.text: I am super satisfied with this sound bar. The sound is incredible, the bass is amazing and the overall sound experience is amazing. I can't believe such good sound comes from a bar and one subwoofer. I only have one complaint, after a few minutes of not using the system, it turns its self off. Not a big deal but can be a small pain. I hung mine on the wall under my TV and I love the looks. Now a movie is an experience. Buy with confidence and enjoy a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, price point is good too
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality, im using the optical input, occasionally Bluetooth, both produced great sound. It does turn off after some inactivity, but didn't bother me much, I did leave it on without any sound coming out, so just turn it back on with the remote, and business as usual. Sizing was good, didn't block my TV's receiver, pretty slick profile with powerful sound.
customer_reviews.author: matt ding

customer_reviews.title: Quality Sound System that's Affordable
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, good factory packaging, and great deal! After reviewing the wireless 2.1 soundbar speaker systems within similar price range and features from Samsung, Vizio, and others...Polk Signa S1 is the best bang for the buck. Samsung and Vizio makes variety of electronics, but Polk is all about the speaker business. I had to give them a shot, and no regrets about it. The product right out of the box was a seamless/no fuss installation/setup. It's intuitive, lightweight, and sounds excellent. Inputs: optical, analog, and Bluetooth. The included optical cable is convenient, and the Bluetooth pairing was smooth. If you are indecisive and still shopping around, stop and save money/time...purchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is great for a soundbar under $200

Unfortunately the refurbished model I received does not work with any source except Bluetooth so it will need to be returned. Otherwise I would rate it higher.
customer_reviews.author: L. Luchs

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound system for your TV, DVD or computer / gaming systems!
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a Polk Audio product before, but had heard of their great sound quality! It IS TRUE! Although we have not put these systems through tough testing, what we have heard is absolutely stunning sound that is very realistic. It is notable that a sound bar, less that 3" per side, can produce such true highs is remarkable. The sub woofer is no slouch either. Haven't played organ music on it yet, but I'm sure it will pass with flying colors. Unique shipping box is the only unusual thing. Have a sharp knife to cut the tape and strong finger nails to pull open the box tabs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Walter

customer_reviews.title: Decent value sound bar
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for the price point. No EQ’s but has movie, night and music presets. The night one is nice to have while the movie and music preset differences are negligible. It has voice adjust in 3 levels and while increasing it helps to hear voices it also makes it extremely tinny and modulated sounding. The sweet spot would be between 2 settings which isn’t possible. It’s also a bit mid-range heavy. Despite it coming with a sub the sound bar doesn’t have a high pass filter which may be the cause for it sounding middy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy! Unit locks up and requires unpluging to fix.

I have to push the buttons multiple times to generate an action from the soundbar. Not a big issue for me as I usually leave it on one volume setting and usually change the input settings on the bar itself.

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Sound!
customer_reviews.text: We use this system for a large screen TV that we roll out to our back patio to watch movies outside. The sound bar was easily attached to the flat screen with a couple of after market brackets and the subwoofer can be put anywhere to enhance the sound because of its bluetooth connection. The sound is amazing, from very deep pounding bass for explosions or concert video to crisp treble and clear dialog. You have to have a 2.1 system to achieve all of that sound in a small space and Polk has pulled out all of the stops with this unit. Remote is easy to control. Love this one.

customer_reviews.title: ... if this unit was just damaged or flat out bad news.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if this unit was just damaged or flat out bad news... the unit was easy to set up and the bar itself has decent sound... what you'd expect from a $150 purchase... the sub woofer however was just noise. Bloated and ill defined at any setting... on numerous occasions the sub basically sounded like a fart as opposed to low frequency response while watching a movie... I just ordered the ZVOX and spent almost $200 more. You get what you pay for... The Polk will be heading to Goodwill as a donation.
customer_reviews.author: markm

customer_reviews.title: Great sounds at this price point
customer_reviews.text: Great sounds at this price point, it made my bedroom movie-watching experience better than my full-blown home theater system in the living room. The base made my floor-standing lamps dance :-) However wall- or TV-mounting it is proving to be a pain... still waiting on Polk customer support to let me know how that feat can be achieved.

customer_reviews.title: I like this sound bar but the remote is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I was getting ready to ship it back because I could not get all the features to work and the volume was not very loud. I set it up on my Harmony remote and all the features worked and the volume was much louder. It does make a difference with voice volume. I like this sound bar but the remote is terrible. I needed to press the buttons several times, sometimes it would work sometimes not. Sent an e mail to ask for a new remote never heard from them.
